subject: Re: banning spam
msgSnippet: Robert: The site is now set to require me to approve posts by new members.  Sorry, you were caught in this spam block.  I was slow in checking e-mail
messageBody:
Robert:

The site is now set to require me to approve posts by "new"
members. Sorry, you were caught in this "spam block." I was slow
in checking e-mail today. As usual, it also took me some time to
find where to go in yahoogroups to make the change in your
membership from "moderated" to "unmoderated."

Do they try to make this site as difficult to use as possible?

Welcome back. I and your fellow QSites will look forward to your
new typeface.

Paige

--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "mcbroom1946"
<mcbroom1946@y...> wrote:
> As a member of both groups (though temporarily incommunicado due
to
> Yahoo's perversity) I would like to second Paige's observations.
>
> Yes, the Shavians are often counting angels on pinheads, but they
are
> charming nonetheless.
>
> And yes, the QS-ites are indeed lurkers for the most part, and
seem conten=
> t to
> practice QS without much preaching. Yet I did really miss the
group during =
> my
> two month Yahoo-imposed hiatus.
>
> To get the email ball rolling again, as it were, I would like to
announce t=
> hat I
> am preparing a new typeface for QS, which I hope will bring on
lots of ku=
> dos
> and brickbats.
>
> More later.
>
>
>
> --- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "Paige Gabhart"
<pgabhart@a...>
> wrote:
> > Oliver:
> >
> > I started this group 3½ years ago because the majority of the
members of
> > the Shaw Alphabet group showed little or no interest in
Quikscript.
> > That was their right, and I don't fault them for that. However,
I had
> > gotten tired of QS being denigrated by some, and I wanted a site
where
> > the members were interested in QS for its own virtues and did
not view
> > it as some afterthought of Kingsley Read of lesser worth than
the Shaw
> > Alphabet.
> >
> > Out of curiosity about a year ago, I compared the e-mail
addresses of
> > the Shaw Alphabet members to the Read Alphabet members. There
was
> some
> > overlap between the two groups, but it was not as extensive as I
had
> > anticipated. My memory is that roughly 20% of the members were
signed
> > on to both groups at that time.
> >
> > Due to the occasional mentioning of the Shaw Alphabet group in
Read
> > Alphabet posts and vice versa, it is probable that most members
are
> > aware of the other group's existence. If those signed on one
list are
> > interested in the posts of the other group, they can certainly
sign on
> > to the other group so I see no need to combine the two groups at
this
> > time.
> >
> > Additionally, the dynamics of the two groups are quite
different. The
> > Read Alphabet group is frequently comatose with many lurkers.
(I would
> > like to change that) On the other hand, the Shaw Alphabet group
loves
> > to discuss minutiae at length. Of course, that's just my humble
> > opinion. :-)
> >
> >
> > Paige
> >
> > I, for one, would not mind seeing the two groups merge somehow.
I
> > realize that the two
> > alphabets are distinct, and of course I don't want to see a
> > which-is-better flame war start;
> > but it seems to me that the discussions on both lists would be
> > interesting to members of
> > the other, so...
> >
> > oliver
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> > Yahoo! Groups Sponsor
> >
> >
